articles.title: Pyongyang Orphans' Primary School Completed
articles.content:
Pyongyang Orphans' Primary School Completed
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang Orphans' Primary School were successfully completed.
					 The school is equipped with multi-functional classrooms and all other best amenities for education and life.
					
					 Its inaugural ceremony took place on Sunday.
					
					 Present there were Choe Thae Bok, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, officials, teaching staff and pupils of the school and officials of the party and power organs and relevant units, working people in the city and builders.
					
					 Cha Hui Rim, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, in his address stressed the need for the teaching staff of the school to raise their qualification as educators, steadily improve the content, form and method of education and take warm care of orphans and thus reliably train them into reliable successors to the Korean revolution and pillars of the country.
					
					 After the ceremony, orphans entered the new school building amid the warm welcome of the participants.
					
					 The participants went round various parts of the school with orphans.

articles.title: 70th Anniversary of Korean Film Studio Marked
articles.content:
70th Anniversary of Korean Film Studio Marked
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The Korean Film Studio marks its 70th founding anniversary.
					 President Kim Il Sung founded the studio on February 6, Juche 36 (1947) and clearly indicated the mission and duty of cinematic art and orientation of filming in each period and at each stage of the developing revolution and wisely led it to create revolutionary and popular films.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il had worked heart and soul for the development of cinematic art since his first visit to the studio.
					
					 The campaign for bringing a turn in film-making is getting brisk at the studio under the deep care of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un who is carrying forward the great leaders' Juche-based idea on literature and arts and high intention.
					
					 A meeting was held on Sunday to mark the 70th anniversary of the Studio, with the attendance of Kim Ki Nam, vice-chairman of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, Pak Chun Nam, minister of Culture, officials of the Studio and relevant units and creators and artistes.

articles.title: Oath-taking Meeting of Schoolchildren Held at Paektusan Secret Camp
articles.content:
Oath-taking Meeting of Schoolchildren Held at Paektusan Secret Camp
 Samjiyon, February 5 (KCNA) -- Schoolchildren from across the country met at the birthplace of leader Kim Jong Il in the Paektusan Secret Camp on Sunday to vow to steadily carry on the march started from Mt Paektu under the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the mosaic in the camp depicting the images of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war heroine Kim Jong Suk and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Present at the meeting were officials concerned and the members of the expedition of schoolchildren to Kim Jong Il's birthplace.
					
					 Led by Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the Central Committee of the youth league, the participants pledged to accomplish the cause of the Juche revolution, the cause of the Songun revolution pioneered in Mt Paektu.
					
					 At the end of the meeting they visited the Paektusan Secret Camp.

articles.title: Oun Revolutionary Site Draws Many Visitors
articles.content:
Oun Revolutionary Site Draws Many Visitors
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Many people in the DPRK visit the Oun Revolutionary Site, which is associated with revolutionary activities of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 More than 20,000 service personnel and civilians have visited the site this year alone.
					
					 They hardened their will to prepare themselves to be strong in ideology and faith to defend respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un politically and ideologically and at the risk of their lives through poem recitations and oratorical meetings held at the site.

articles.title: Bolstering Military Capabilities for Self-Defence Is Legitimate Right of DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Bolstering Military Capabilities for Self-Defence Is Legitimate Right of DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's military capabilities for self-defence are not to invade or threaten others, and they serve as a powerful treasured sword and deterrence of justice for defending the sovereignty and the right to existence of the country and safeguarding the peace and security in the region and the world, stresses Rodong Sinmun Sunday in an article.
					 The way for foiling the moves of the U.S. imperialists and their stooges for a nuclear war, ensuring lasting peace on the Korean peninsula and achieving the country's reunification is to bolster up the military capabilities and the nuclear deterrence, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 To bolster up the military capabilities for self-defence is the legitimate right of the DPRK.
					
					 It is our fixed will to continue to bolster the capabilities for self-defence and preemptive attack with the nuclear force as a core unless the U.S. and its vassal forces stop their nuclear threat and blackmail and war exercises at the doorstep of the DPRK staged under the pretext of annual ones.
					
					 Songun Korea is reliably defending the sovereignty and dignity of the country and peace and security in the Korean peninsula, Northeast Asia and the rest of the world. The DPRK emerged the strongest nuclear weapons state despite unprecedented difficulties and hardships and, therefore, it has nothing to be afraid of-- whether it is sanction, pressure or war.
					
					 The DPRK will courageously foil any military provocation and threats of the enemies by dint of the single-minded unity of its army and people that can not be found in any other parts of the world and with the nuclear deterrence which it has built up while pushing back the frontiers of the latest science and technology under the banner of the simultaneous development of military and economic sectors.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams Pro-U.S. Traitors' Disgusting Act
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams Pro-U.S. Traitors' Disgusting Act
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces are showing servile attitude to the new master of the White House, drawing derision of the public.
					 After a telephone conversation with the new U.S. president, puppet prime minister Hwang Kyo An and his stooges shouted for joy as if their way-out is opened. Clinging more closely to the coattail of their new master, they are going busy to earn favor of their master and realize ambition for confrontation with the fellow countrymen while giving wide publicity to the south Korea visit by the new U.S. defence secretary.
					
					 Commenting on such behaviors, Minju Joson brands this as a disgusting act of the group of traitors serving the U.S.
					
					 It is a clumsy farce of confrontational maniacs bereft of ability of judging the situation to try to find a way-out in dependence on outsiders and confrontation with the fellow countrymen, the commentary says, adding:
					
					 A dear price has to be paid for such traitorous and anti-reunification moves as well as the crimes committed by Park Geun Hye against the nation.
					
					 The Korean nation is responsible for settling the reunification issue. We will hold hands with whoever values fundamental interests of the nation and wishes for improvement of the north-south relations. This is our consistent stand.
					
					 The south Korean authorities have to come to their senses and opt for improving the relations with the north in response to our patriotic appeal.  Herein lies a way-out for them.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Hit for Inciting Confrontation with Fellow Countrymen
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Hit for Inciting Confrontation with Fellow Countrymen
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the south Korean puppet air force staged mad-cap search and rescue exercises with the U.S. imperialist aggression forces under the signboard of Pacific Thunder.
					 The war drill that lasted for over ten days from Jan. 23 was waged under the simulation of an actual war. It involved more than 30 airplanes with different missions like fighters, helicopters, early warning planes and air-refueling tanker and more than 250 troops of the U.S. air force and over 10 fighters and copters and at least 130 troops of the south Korean puppet air force.
					
					 Meanwhile, military bosses of south Korea including the defence minister and the chief of the air force staff inspected army units on the occasion of the lunar New Year's Day, inciting extreme consciousness of confrontation while talking about "nuclear and missile threats from the north" and "full combat posture".
					
					 Commenting on the facts, Rodong Sinmun Sunday charges that the south Korean puppet forces are using even folk holiday as an occasion of fanning up the confrontation atmosphere while staging DPRK-targeted war exercises together with the U.S. imperialist aggression forces. This is a despicable act of die-hard warmongers keen on doing harm to the fellow countrymen and of gangsters who pay no heed to the folk holidays.
					
					 The war exercises are an extremely provocative rehearsal aimed at preemptive air strike at the depth of the DPRK in case of emergency, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 To traitors who go helter-skelter to do harm to the fellow countrymen, bereft of reason, in collusion with outsiders, folk holidays only serve as an occasion of inciting confrontation with the fellow countrymen.
					
					 The Korean nation can never live in peace as long as the group of traitors finding a way-out in cooperation with outsiders and in provocative moves for aggression on the north, indifferent to the destiny of the nation, goes with impunity.
					
					 The DPRK will never tolerate the south Korean puppet forces getting hell-bent on the moves to provoke a war in league with outsiders against the trend of the times for the improved north-south relations.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Flails Inveterate Bad Habit of S. Korean Authorities
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Flails Inveterate Bad Habit of S. Korean Authorities
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, Hwang Kyo An, acting president of south Korea, told his men to promote the diplomacy and security policy without vacillation, talking about "the north's deceptive dialogue offensive and additional provocation" at a "meeting for judging situation and taking measures".
					 The gentry of the puppet foreign and unification ministries has become all the more zealous in begging for international cooperation for sanctions against the DPRK and confrontation racket with fellow countrymen, stressing the need to check the "north's dialogue offensive devoid of sincerity" and strengthen the pressure for "change and denuclearization".
					
					 Meanwhile, the south Korean puppet military authorities are hell-bent on the military provocative moves to stifle the DPRK by force from the outset of the year. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun on Sunday says in an article in this regard:
					
					 The south Korean puppet authorities' above-said confrontational rackets reveal their unchanged inveterate bad habit and traitorous nature.
					
					 They are no more than the last-ditch efforts of the confrontational maniacs upset by the trend of the times toward the improvement of the north-south relations.
					
					 Recently the south Korean authorities put pressure upon the organizations and personages of all social standings desirous of the improvement of the north-south relations and the national reunification, while resorting to the sanctions and pressure on the DPRK and provocative moves to ignite a war against the DPRK in league with foreign forces. This is the desperate wriggle to dampen the aspiration for the reunification through alliance with the north growing stronger among the south Korean people and evade the crisis of ruin.
					
					 However desperately the south Korean conservative group may kick up the anti-DPRK racket, it can never check the fellow countrymen's aspiration and united struggle for the improved north-south relations and national reunification.

articles.title: Hwang Kyo An Accused of Working Hard to Deploy THAAD in S. Korea
articles.content:
Scheme to Push Ahead THAAD Deployment in S. Korea Flailed
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People Friday carried an editorial accusing the puppet authorities which is pushing forward the deployment of THAAD despite of the people's opposition.
					 The editorial noted that the U.S. defense secretary stressed the need to push ahead with THAAD deployment during his junket to south Korea.
					
					 It charged that the regime's decision on THAAD deployment is a blatant challenge to democracy.

articles.title: Int'l Preparatory Committee Formed to Mark Birth Anniversaries of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Int'l Preparatory Committee Formed to Mark Birth Anniversaries of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- An international preparatory committee was formed on January 30 to celebrate the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the 75th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Mikhail Panchenko, general secretary of the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions, was elected chairman of the international preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to set up celebration preparatory committees at Juche idea study organizations of different countries and organize seminars on the Juche idea and Songun policy on those occasions.

articles.title: Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to be Celebrated in Nepal
articles.content:
Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to be Celebrated in Nepal
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- A Nepalese national preparatory committee was formed in Kathmandu on January 27 to celebrate the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star, birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					 C. P. Mainali, general secretary of the C.C., Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) and former deputy prime minister of Nepal, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to introduce the revolutionary careers of the peerlessly great men of Mt Paektu through media and organize various political and cultural events.
					
					 At its inaugural ceremony, a declaration was made public in praise of Kim Il Sung, who fathered the Juche idea, liberated Korea from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and founded the party, the state and the army, and Kim Jong Il, who defended socialism in the DPRK and reliably ensured world peace and security with the unique Songun politics.
					
					 A congratulatory message to respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un was adopted.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to be Celebrated in Indonesia
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to be Celebrated in Indonesia
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- An Indonesian preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, was formed on January 25.
					 Ristiyanto, secretary general of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set a celebration period from January 25 to February 16 and decided to organize diverse political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il in the period.

articles.title: DPRK's Stand Supported by German Organization
articles.content:
DPRK's Stand Supported by German Organization
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany issued a statement on Jan. 23 in support of an appeal made at a joint conference of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The adoption of the appeal dealt another deadly blow to the U.S. and the separatist forces of south Korea.
					
					 This means a clear demonstration of the Korean people's fixed will to reunify their beloved country at any cost.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet group are evil forces desperately checking the reunification of Korea and seeking division and confrontation.
					
					 No matter how malignantly the U.S. and its vassal forces may slander the DPRK with all sorts of lies and deception, the latter's cause is just.
					
					 Justice is sure to triumph.
					
					 We fully support the above-said appeal.
